benchmark_details.name: CCFQA (Cross-lingual and Cross-modal Factuality Evaluation)
benchmark_details.overview: CCFQA is a benchmark that contains parallel speech-text factual questions across 8 languages, designed to systematically evaluate MLLMsâ€™ cross-lingual and cross-modal factuality capabilities.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a foundational research resource to promote the development of MLLMs with more robust and reliable speech understanding capabilities.

data.source: Collected from existing QA datasets and manually curated.
data.annotation: Manual curation and professional translation into target languages.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on the consistency of model responses to the same question across different languages and modalities.
methodology.interpretation: Higher F1 scores indicate better consistency in factual responses across languages and modalities.
methodology.validation: The benchmark was validated through systematic evaluation of existing MLLMs.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: All volunteers have signed a Voice Authorization License Agreement for the use of recorded speech.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.compliance_with_regulations: Data usage complies with applicable privacy and data protection regulations.
